adrFormatAddress: 200 Park Ave, New York, NY 10166, USA

originalText.text: After using the atm I needed to use the bathroom. The guy was willing to help, but needed to help a customer he was with. While we were waiting a blonde bimbo told us bathrooms were not available to customers. I have been a Bank of America customer longer than she has been alive. I am not surprised by the poor customer service ratings of this location at all if they don't provide basic amenities to their long time customers.

originalText.text: Miss Emma R.  was wonderful and very loving, he has a very smiling face and gives people positive energy

text.text: Miss Emma R.  was wonderful and very loving, he has a very smiling face and gives people positive energy

originalText.text: BOA sent me a cashier check that isn't signed. The check got rejected by my bank and I have not been able to get the funds out, so frustrating!!

text.text: BOA sent me a cashier check that isn't signed. The check got rejected by my bank and I have not been able to get the funds out, so frustrating!!

originalText.text: I walked into the bank to speak to someone about depositing a check the amount of the check was significant and I wanted to have a conversation well the woman insisted in speaking with me out in front of everyone I specifically asked for privacy she insisted we speak right there and then proceeded to tell me she was the manager. I told her nevermind and walked out. I don't know if she thought I was broke or that my banking wasn't significant enough to warrant decency but I didn't like it and what's worse is that I walk with a walker right now yet and still she expected for me to stand at the desk in the entrance to discuss my money. I am really thinking of closing my whole account because of her and needless to say I did not deposit my check in that account and used a secondary account at a different bank instead.  This situation occurred late last week and i know that she remembers me bad business.
